terrain.surface: Gravel roads through Australian remote countryside. Moderate elevation with remote scenery.

gravel_god_rating.score_note: Local Australian event. Remote terrain with very remote access, moderate costs, and small local field.

biased_opinion.summary: Wild Gravel is a local event in Western Australia—remote terrain with moderate elevation. The Australian remote scenery is scenic, but the very small field, very remote location, and limited organization keep it in Tier 4.
biased_opinion.bottom_line: A solid local Australian remote gravel race. Worth it for Western Australia/Australian riders. Not worth traveling for.

final_verdict.should_you_race: If you're local to Western Australia—yes, it's good value. If you're traveling—skip it.
final_verdict.alternatives: For better Australian races: Gravel Gong, Dirty Gravel.

logistics.lodging_strategy: Gnowangerup has very limited lodging options. Plan ahead.
logistics.food: Gnowangerup has very limited dining options. Stock nutrition.
logistics.camping: camping and accommodation in nearby towns along the Wild Gravel Trail loop are options

non_negotiables.why: Australian remote conditions require specific preparation.
Limited organization and very remote location require extreme self-sufficiency.

logistics.explanation: Perth is 340km away, Albany 140km - either route requires commitment for a second-year event. The Shire of Gnowangerup runs registration through their government email wildgravel@gnowangerup.wa.gov.au, which reflects the grassroots scale.

length.explanation: The 60-mile distance sits among 15 total options from 5km walks to 150km races. Multiple distance categories include gravel runs, duathlons, and walks, letting families pick their challenge level across the weekend. Similar distance to Crusher in the Tushar.

technicality.explanation: Primarily gravel through Stirling Ranges with Stirling Range Drive and Red Gum Pass Road closed for the event. The 42.2km run earns a ★★★★★ difficulty rating, indicating challenging terrain through rugged national park sections. Less technical than The Mid South.

elevation.explanation: The marathon run packs 853m of elevation gain with big climbs noted through Stirling Range terrain. Undulating profiles with significant climbing, though detailed elevation breakdowns remain unavailable for cycling distances. Less climbing than The Mid South.

climate.explanation: October timing coincides with vibrant wildflower season in the Stirling Ranges, creating spectacular scenery. As a second-year event following 2024 success, limited weather history exists for condition predictions. More weather exposure than Belgian Waffle Ride San Diego.

altitude.explanation: This is Western Australia, not the Rockies. The Stirling Ranges provide the highest peaks for thousands of kilometres around, but that's relative to coastal plains with no significant altitude challenges. Lower altitude than Gravel Worlds — no thin-air concerns.

adventure.explanation: Racing through Stirling Range National Park during wildflower season covers nearly 1,200 square kilometres of biodiversity hotspot. The course travels through Koi Kyeneu-ruff with iconic Stirling Ranges terrain featuring rugged landscapes and wildlife viewing.

prestige.explanation: Second-year event organized by Shire of Gnowangerup from their government email address. While the 100km and 150km distances earned Auscycling sanctioning for 2025, the race lacks established winners or professional field recognition.

race_quality.explanation: The 100km and 150km distances earned Auscycling sanctioning requiring race licenses. Road closures include Stirling Range Drive for safety, with timed results posted within 48 hours and 6-hour time limits for longer events.

experience.explanation: You'll ride through Stirling Ranges during wildflower season from the AFGRI Event Village, 7km west of Chester Pass Road. Friday's Gnowangerup Community Gravel features bike obstacle courses and learn-to-ride programming as warm-up events.

community.explanation: The Friday Gnowangerup Community Gravel was selected as the major regional event for 2025 WA Bike Month. Event organizer Tim brings over-50 State Champion downhill MTB racing background to the family-friendly weekend format.

field_depth.explanation: Second-year event in rural Western Australia, 340km from Perth population centers. While longer distances earned Auscycling sanctioning, the competitive field remains regional with weekend warriors and curiosity participants. Thinner field than Ouray Gravel Grinder.

value.explanation: Fifteen participation options from 5km walks to 150km races, plus run+ride duathlon combinations maximize entry value. Friday community programming with food, music, and learn-to-ride sessions adds family appeal beyond race day.

expenses.explanation: Registration runs $75-100 AUD. Perth flights or 340km drives required to reach remote Gnowangerup, with Albany 140km away as alternative access. The Wild Gravel Trail mentions 8 towns with accommodation, but wildflower season booking in remote WA presents challenges.

2024.conditions: Historical weather incidents: No records of mud, heat, or wind issues found (event new, following 2024 success)
key_takeaways: Historical weather incidents: No records of mud, heat, or wind issues found (event new, following 2024 success)
Race history (founded year, founder if known): Debuted 2024, returning 2025; inspired Wild Gravel Trail

primary.name: Specialized Pathfinder Pro
primary.why: Fast center, grippy edges. The modern all-rounder benchmark.

primary.name: Panaracer GravelKing SK
primary.why: Affordable all-rounder. Light knobs add grip without killing speed.

primary.name: Vittoria Terreno Mix
primary.why: Graphene versatility. Mixed-terrain grip with reasonable rolling speed.

front_rear_split.rationale: Faster front for reduced rolling resistance on straights, grippier rear for traction on loose climbs and corners

videos.title: Wild Gravel 2024
videos.description: The Shire of Gnowangerup organised a wicked Wild Gravel event in 2024. Planning for 2026 is underway, save the date! 11th October 2026.

videos.title: 2025 Wild Gravel 150km Race 2271vm
videos.description:
150km Gravel Race Stirling Range Gnowangerup Western Australia
https://wildgravel.com.au/

My first 150km race. Was a pretty tough day out on the Canyon Grail, but the scenery was spectacular and made all the climbs back to the finish line all worth it.
videos.curation_reason: First-person race recap of the 150km Wild Gravel race with detailed course experience from recent 2025 event.

videos.title: Boulder's Happy Thursday Cruiser Ride
videos.description:
HAPPY THURSDAY!!
I've been riding the Boulder Cruiser Ride since 1999 and it's BY FAR my favorite activity every summer. Hundreds of people gather each week to cruise the streets of Boulder and spread joy and goofiness! Wanna join? Follow http://instagram.com/boulderbikenight for info.

SUBSCRIBE TO DUZERTV FOR ENDLESS ADVENTURE! ► http://bit.ly/DUZERTVSUB

Support my channel on Patreon and get early releases with zero ads!
Patreon: https://www.patreon.com/RyanVanDuzer
Or PayPal for one time payments: http://bit.ly/RyanVanDuzer (choose Family and Friends to eliminate fees)
Venmo @RyanVanDuzer

Socials:
https://www.instagram.com/duzer
https://twitter.com/duzer

Check out these adventure series:
The Great Divide https://bit.ly/3r5cj1t
The Colorado Trail https://bit.ly/3je5eHF
Baja Divide https://bit.ly/377dHts
Biking Cuba https://bit.ly/3O5Z36G
Love Cycles (across the USA) https://bit.ly/3DUbs98
Running with Ryan https://bit.ly/3NTVmRi
Bike Gear Rundowns https://bit.ly/3KmercM

**Welcome to DuzerTV** This channel is dedicated to inspiring viewers to get off their couches and explore this beautiful world (or even your backyard). You'll find videos about biking, running, trekking, traveling, do goodery, and anything that involves being outside and enjoying life. Join TeamDuzer and let's have some fun!

#RyanVanDuzer #TeamDuzer
email: ryanvanduzer AT gmail.com

Camera Gear:
DJI Mavic Mini3
Sony RX100Vii
GoPro Hero 10

All the music on my Channel is from Musicbed.com
Wanna sign up for your own account? Use my referral link:
http://share.mscbd.fm/duzer
*I do get some compensation if you choose to sign up
